channel.title: fsck on Blah, Cloud
channel.description: Recent content in fsck on Blah, Cloud

item.title: Recovering NSX Manager with corrupt filesystem
item.description: I had a bit of a storage outage in my lab due to a funky behaviour on the Synology that I use as primary storage for all my VMs: Today I Learned: Adding IP address to interfaces on Synology causes reboots :/ Lab now in not such great shape. 80 VMs with APD. #vExpert — Myles Gray (@mylesagray) November 13, 2016 Most stuff came back up or could at least be trivially fixed (like VCSA, PSCs, etc) you can edit the GRUB boot string and force into /bin/bash then run fsck from there.
